cluster_relations.rel_desc: Birds serve as indicators of ecosystem condition/environmental health.
Bird populations act as indicators of overall ecosystem condition (health and quality).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: IndicatorType: environmental health and ecosystem quality

remarks: Ecosystem health and ecosystem quality are jointly interpreted as aspects of ecosystem condition.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Changes in bird behaviors serve as indicators of ecosystem condition.

qualifiers.CausalHint: can signal shifts in environmental conditions

remarks: Specific behaviors not detailed; relation captures their indicative role.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Changes in bird distributions indicate changes in environmental conditions, reflecting ecosystem condition.
Changes in bird populations signal shifts in environmental conditions, thus reflecting ecosystem condition.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject serves as an indicator or proxy for the state or condition of the object (e.g., bird metrics indicating ecosystem condition).
args.justification: All relations describe various bird-related features (birds, bird populations, behaviors, distributions) serving as indicators of ecosystem condition or environmental state. They share the same predicate semantics: the subject is used to infer or indicate the condition of the object.

Each relation connects an environmental indicator (bird-related attribute) to an underlying environmental or ecosystem state. Grouping them under an 'environmental_indicator_relation' class captures their shared role as indicators or proxies of environmental condition.

Indicator relations associate observable bird-related variables with ecosystem condition without asserting direct causality; they are correlational/associative links used for inference rather than mechanistic cause-effect.
